Hunt, John Horbury (Person)
record.detail: Architect who produced highly individual buildings of complex form and asymmetrical balance including the Chapel of the Sacred Heart Convent at Rose Bay and Cloncorrick at Darling Point.

record.detail: By kind permission of the Baglin estate

P-ID: 13181 P-DoS Notes: 6. Christ: central panel of Transfiguration window, All Saints’ Church, Hunters Hill. Made by Morris & Co. (London), 1919, to a design by Sir Edward Burne-Jones. Photo by Douglass Baglin From colour transparencies supplied by Bev Sherry. Copyright resides with Douglass Baglin's estate. The contact is Yvonne Austin (his niece): yvonne.austin@clearmail.com.au 'Winnunga', Nellies Glen Road, Megalong Valley, NSW 2785, ph: 02 4787 9177 / 0428 170 220. Bev has verbal approval, need it in writing as well. P-Related: Stained Glass

record.title: unique
record.detail: A beautiful Pre-Raphaelite Christ, expressively portrayed by Sir Edward Burne-Jones (1833–1898) forms the central panel of the Transfiguration window in All Saints' church, Hunters Hill. It was made by Morris & Co in London in 1926. After Burne-Jones's death in 1898, Morris & Co continued to use his cartoons. This design had first been executed in 1874 at St Cuthbert’s church, Lytham, Lancashire.

Bev's caption: A beautiful Pre-Raphaelite Christ, expressively portrayed by Sir Edward Burne-Jones (1833-1898): central panel of Transfiguration window, All Saints’ church, Hunters Hill. Made by Morris & Co. (London), 1926. After Burne-Jones’s death Morris & Co, continued to use his cartoons.

record.title: stunning
record.detail: The east window of All Saints’ was inspired by the words of the hymn Te Deum Laudamus and is known as the Te Deum window. The central scene is the Crucifixion and the Last Supper is depicted below it. This detail shows Judas conspicuously lacking a halo and clutching the bag of money he received for betraying Jesus. The Scottish artist Andrew Wells, then a partner in the Sydney-based firm of Lyon & Cottier, designed the window, which was installed in 1889.

ref: http://www.huntershill.anglican.asn.au/galleries/ Bev's caption: Detail of The Last Supper: lower panel of east window, All Saints’ church, Hunters Hill, showing Judas clutching a bag of money. Lyon & Cottier (Sydney), 1889
